books.name: Bhagavad Gita As It Is
books.description: The Bhagavad Gita ('Song of God') is a 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the epic Mahabharata, dated to the second half of the first millennium BCE and is typical of the Hindu synthesis.

books.name: Srimad Bhagavatam
books.description: The Srimad-Bhagavatam, also known as the Bhagavata Purana, is one of Hinduism's eighteen great Puranas. It contains transcendental knowledge to bring about a revolution in the impious lives of disinterested civilization.

books.name: Sri Caitanya-caritamrta
books.description: Sri Caitanya-caritamrta is the biography of Lord Caitanya Mahaprabhu written by Krishnadasa Kaviraja Goswami in the late 16th century. It describes in detail Lord Caitanya's life and teachings.
